section.name: Apache Ant™ Project Processes/Checklists
section.p: Here we describe some of the processes we use.

section.name: Retire a subproject or component
section.p: The process starts by a format vote by the Ant PMC on the main development mailinglist. Basically we have to announce it and make resources read-only.

subsection.name: Retire: Version Control
subsection.p:
Most of our source code is in git, only "site" and "sandbox" use subversion. We place a marker RETIRED_PROJECT file on the top level.
Add a note at the top of a README file as well so it is immediately visible to people browsing the github mirror. Include a link to this page for a possible future reactivation and a link to the vote result.
Ask infra to make the repository read-only.

subsection.name: Retire: Issue Tracker
subsection.p: If the subproject/component has its own issue tracker we have to close that. It is enough to make it read-only, so these information are longer available.

subsection.name: Retire: Mailing List
subsection.p: If the subproject/component has its own mailing list we have to close this. We should send a final email.

subsection.name: Retire: Announcement
subsection.p: We have to announce the retirement of the subproject at dev@ant, announce@apache and the Ant main page.

subsection.name: Retire: Build Jobs
subsection.p: All build jobs on Jenkins@Apache, TeamCity and Gump have to be deleted.

subsection.name: Retire: Homepage
subsection.p: Add the retirement to the archive-page.

subsection.name: Retire: Releases
subsection.p: The last released artifacts, if any, should be removed from the Apache distribution server. To do so, remove any artifact related to the retired subproject in https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/ant/ (it is managed with subversion). Note: as every Apache release, nothing is deleted but everything is archived, the artifacts will still be available at https://archive.apache.org/dist/ant/ (or http://archive.apache.org/dist/incubator/ for Incubator releases).

subsection.name: Retire: Free Further Resources
subsection.p: Maybe a subproject locks further resources (update-site, ...). So we have to unblock them.

section.name: Reactivate a subproject or component
section.p: The process starts by a format vote by the Ant PMC on the main development mailinglist. Basically we have to announce it and make resources read-write again.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Version Control
subsection.p:
Delete the marker file "RETIRED_PROJECT".
Delete the note at the top of a README file as well so it is immediately visible to people browsing the github mirror.
Ask infra to make the repository read-write again.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Issue Tracker
subsection.p: If the subproject/component has its own issue tracker we have to reopen that.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Mailing List
subsection.p: Because reopeing implies a smaller community we should use the main mailinglist dev@ant. So reactivating a special list is not required and could be postponed to a later PMC decision.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Announcement
subsection.p: Announce the reactivation of the subproject at dev@ant. Decide about announcing the reactivation of the subproject at announce@apache.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Build Jobs
subsection.p: New build jobs on Jenkins@Apache, TeamCity and Gump could be created as required.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Homepage
subsection.p: Remove the component from the archive-page.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Releases
subsection.p: All earlier releases are available at https://archive.apache.org/dist/ant/. We don't have to copy them back to https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/ant/. But further releases are placed here.

subsection.name: Reactivate: Free Further Resources
subsection.p: Make existing read-only resources read-write again. Further resources could be gained as required.
